definition: lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
thirsty
to dig
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing
a well/CL:口[kou3]/neat/orderly

sentences.english: As the saying goes, "Dig your well before you're thirsty."
sentences.chinese: 老话说得好啊，不要临渴掘井。

definition: He who gives no thought to far-flung problems soon finds suffering nearby (idiom, from Analects)./Smug concentration on the here and now will lead to future sorrow.
pinyin: ren2 wu2 yuan3 lu:4 , bi4 you3 jin4 you1

definition: to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud
lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
lit. to bend the chimney and remove the firewood (to prevent fire) (idiom)/fig. to take preventive measures
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/short attention span
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
to work hard while accomplishing little/to toil to no avail
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom)/fig. time invested in preparations is not lost/a beard well lathered is half shaved
pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1

definition: lit. to see a bow reflected in a cup as a snake (idiom); fig. unnecessary suspicions/overly fearful
it is not too late (idiom)
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
one day's sun, ten days' frost (idiom, from Mencius); fig. to work for a bit then skimp/sporadic effort/lack of sticking power/short attention span
